Beers and burgers a winning combination at 11th annual North Miami BrewFest Beer education event is a huge success Business & Entrepreneurship By Ivonne Yee-Amor November 22, 2023 at 11:25am The people have spoken and when it comes to beer and food, it seems wildberries, Japanese rice lagers and hamburgers are their top choice. That’s because craft brewery Rocketeer Beer & Liquid Provisions of Kendall and craft burger restaurant La Birra Bar in North Miami took home the top spots and the People's Choice Awards for Best Brewery and Best Eatery, respectively, at this year’s 11 th annual North Miami BrewFest , produced by and benefiting FIU’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management . “It’s an honor to be here every single year, and we are privileged to take first place. We are humbled,” said Rocketeer Beer co-owners Rudy Delgado and Rick Abreu as they reveled in their win. Last year, the craft brewers took home third place. This year the two upped their game by offering the more than 1,300 attendees seven different beers, one that had wild blueberries and blackberries in it and another made with Japanese rice lager. Three local craft breweries took home the hardware for best brewery. From left to right: Brewers Rudy Delgado and Rick Abreu of Rocketeer Beer & Liquid Provisions came in first place, team member Ramon San Martin of Prison Pals Brewing Co. voted second, and Anastasia Fraga, marketing director for Johnny Cuba took home third place. Nearly 40 distinguised craft breweries and more than two dozen eateries took part in the event, serving more than 100 one-of-a-kind beers and bites. This year the largest crowd ever turned out for event at its new venue, the NOMI Village off 123 rd Street and I-95, not far from FIU's Biscayne Bay Campus. “We are very happy about this win,” said Emmanuel Arballo, co-owner of La Birra Bar, a craft burger joint appearing for the first time at the festival. While it may have been their first time at BrewFest, it’s not their first FIU-related win. They took home Best Burger at last year’s Burger Bash at the Food Network South Beach Wine & Food Festival presented by Capital One (SOBEWFF®) . “It was an amazing experience and the student volunteers were great and very detail oriented,” added Arballo. The three best eateries included two burger joints. From left to right: La Birra Bar in North Miami took home first place, El Desembarco in Miami came in third, and Off the Hook Churrascaria in Miami came in second place. The event is produced by the Chaplin School and helped run by its students. Many are members of student clubs such as event production club Back of House , the Bacardi Center of Excellence Bartender's Guild and the school's award-winning student-run restaurant, the FIU Bistro . The event's mission is to contribute to brewing science education and innovation for the craft brewing industry, brewpubs and homebrew organizations. As for the best beers and bites, who else took home top prize? Best Brewery: 1 st place Rocketeer Beer & Liquid Provisions 2 nd place Prison Pals Brewing Co. 3 rd place Jo hnny Cuba Best Eatery: 1 st place La Birra Bar 2 nd place Off the Hook Churrascaria – a Brazilian fusion steakhouse 3 rd place El Desembarco Festivalgoers 21 and older enjoyed more than 100 brews and bites. The event is produced by FIU Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management staff and supported by more than three dozen student volunteers. More than two dozen exhibitors, like Rocketeeer Beer & Liquid Provisions, are part of the growing craft beer industry. FIU Hospitality is brewing up a great lineup for this yearâs North Miami BrewFest | FIU News - Florida International University Skip to Content Florida International University FIU Hospitality is brewing up a great lineup for this yearâs North Miami BrewFest Search Menu Menu FIU Hospitality is brewing up a great lineup for this yearâs North Miami BrewFest FIU Hospitality offers discount to the FIU family Campus & Community By Ivonne Yee-Amor October 25, 2024 at 4:22pm Who says working at FIU doesn’t have any perks? The FIU family is invited to the 12th annual North Miami Brewfest coming up on Saturday, November 16, 2024 from 4-8pm at the Nomi Village on 123 rd Street and NW 7 th Avenue in North Miami at a discounted price. The festival is produced by and benefits FIU’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management and its beverage management major and students. Alumni, faculty, staff and students over 21 can use the promo code FIUFAM15 for a 15% discount on tickets. “North Miami BrewFest started as an idea in our classroom by students and their professor, so we want to make sure that the FIU community has a chance to attend to help support our school and the future leaders of beverage management and hospitality,” said Mohammad Qureshi, North Miami BrewFest director and faculty administrator. More than 75 beers will be on tap and served up by more than 30 craft breweries and 20 eateries that will share their best brews and delicious dishes. Local breweries who will be there include, FIU Alumni like MIA Beer Co ., The Tank , La Rubia , Black Pit Brewing , Rocketeer Beer & Liquid Provisions , Owl’s Brew and Tripping Animals Brewing . South Florida’s best restaurants and eateries attending include: La Birra Bar , Le Chick Miami , Sweet Green , Soulful Biscuit , and FIU Chaplin School Alums, Temple Street Eatery and Night Owl Cookies , French Bistro , Exquisite Catering by Robert , and Miami's famed Versailles Restaurant . Last year's winners of Best Brewery at the 2023 North Miami BrewFest will be back again this year. For the first time this year, North Miami BrewFest is excited to announce a number of big sponsors like MUV, Checkers Rally's, Henckels Zwilling offering up a cooking demo and the Homestead-Miami Speedway , which will be showcasing vehicles fresh off its NASCAR Cup Series Playoff. FIU Chaplin School student run organizations such as the Bartender’s Guild from the Bacardi Center of Excellence program will be showcasing their craft beer cocktails, Chef John Noble Masi will be serving up the best from the FIU's only student-run and award-winning restaurant called the FIU Bistro and Professors Barry Gump and Albert Rivera, along with their students, will be pouring their unique brews. "We hope this discount allows even more FIU alumni and friends to join us for the best all-inclusive beer festival in South Florida," ended Qureshi. To purchase tickets, please visit NorthMiamiBrewfest.com or Eventbrite . North Miami BrewFest announces the winners of its fan favorites awards | FIU News - Florida International University Skip to Content Florida International University North Miami BrewFest announces the winners of its fan favorites awards Search Menu Menu Winners of the people's choice best brews and bites winners North Miami BrewFest announces the winners of its fan favorites awards Campus & Community By Ivonne Yee-Amor November 19, 2024 at 2:07pm The fans have voted and it’s a repeat win for Best Brewery and Best Bite at this year’s North Miami BrewFest . Beer and food lovers attending the 12 th annual event cast their votes and seems they just couldn’t get enough of the independent and FIU alumni-owned craft brewery, Rocketeer Beer & Liquid Provisions, in West Kendall, and Argentinian favorite La Birria Bar’s mouth-watering burgers. “We’re so happy to have won the #1 Best Brewery award for the second year in a row,” said Rudy Delgado, Rocketeer Beer co-owner. “Thanks to all of our fans who voted for us, we couldn’t have done it without you,” added co-owner, Ricardo Abreu. Nearly 1,500 guests attended the festival at The Nomi Village in North Miami on Saturday, November 16 th . Guests got a chance to try more than 100 beers and beverages from 35 craft breweries and taste delicious dishes from nearly two dozen of South Florida’s most unique restaurants, food trucks and eateries. Then fans used coins to vote for their favorites. The Nomi Village in North Miami hosted North Miami BrewFest for the second year in a row. First time food truck participant, Taste Good Miami, won third place for their unique take on eggrolls, like their Philly Cheesesteak and Bang Bang Shrimp best sellers. “BrewFest was an awesome experience, allowing me to reach people that had never had my food and gave me a chance to see what they loved about it and how I can get better,” said Gerard Powell, chef and owner of Taste Good Miami. Six local businesses took home top prizes, including craft brewers and beverage makers: 1 st place Rocketeer Beer & Liquid Provisions 2 nd place B rewsaki 3 rd place Lemon Dade Seltzer Two local hamburger restaurants and a food truck won fan favorites for best bite: 1 st place La Birria Bar 2 nd place El Desembarco 3 rd place Taste Good Miami More than 50 FIU alumni and students helped produce the event, which supports FIU Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management and its bachelor’s degree in beverage management . FIU students in the event management club, Back of House, helped organizers run the event. Pour me another cold one: date for North Miami Brewfest announced | FIU News - Florida International University Skip to Content Florida International University Pour me another cold one: date for North Miami Brewfest announced Search Menu Menu Ice cold beer and bites on tap at the 2022 North Miami Brewfest. Campus & Community Pour me another cold one: date for North Miami Brewfest announced Save the date: November 12, 2022 By Ivonne Yee-Amor July 14, 2022 at 2:10pm Florida's best craft brewers and beer lovers will gather again this year in South Florida for the North Miami Brewfest . Today, event organizers announced the yearly gathering is scheduled to take place on Saturday, November 12, 2022, so save the date. This year marks the 10th anniversary of the one-day festival, which began at Florida International University’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management on FIU's Biscayne Bay Campus. Back then, the event was student-led and started to showcase the best brews from FIU's Brew Science program, alongside the industry's emerging talent. Today, more than a thousand people gather to taste more than 150 one-of-a-kind beers and bites from the area's most distinguished craft breweries and restaurants. The event is produced by FIU and is the only local beer festival that offers a beer and food pairing. Get a chance to speak one-on-one with South Florida's best craft brewers and taste some unique flavors. "Beer is one of the top five most consumed beverages in the United States and its popularity is why innovation and education in the craft brew industry is important," said Barry Gump, professor and Harvey R. Chaplin Eminent Scholar Chair in beverage management and the creator of the school's brewing science program. According to the not-for-profit trade group representing small and independent U.S. Brewers, the Brewers Association, craft beer sales went up 7.9% in 2021 resulting in nearly $27 billion dollars in sales. That number is expected to grow this year. Craft brewers, considered small and independent, make up 98% of all breweries in the U.S. FIU alumni, like FIU hospitality graduate and Temple Street restaurant co-owner Alex Kuk, '04, MS '10, have historically taken part in the event. The North Miami Brewfest will take place at the Museum of Contemporary Art (MOCA) Plaza on NE 125th Street in the City of North Miami . For the past five festivals, North Miami has been the Title Partner. One of South Florida's most popular breweries, Funky Buddha , is among the first to announce it will be sharing its creative ales during the event. The Chaplin School's Brewing Science program is open to all students. The top 10 U.S.-ranked hospitality school also offers a bachelor's degree in hospitality management with a beverage management track. The degree is meant for students who want to work in the beverage industry focusing on wine and brewing arts. For more information about the degree, please visit the FIU Chaplin School website or for more information about the 10th annual North Miami Brewfest, please visit, northmiamibrewfest.com for more details. What's on tap: Tickets for the North Miami Brewfest now on sale | FIU News - Florida International University Skip to Content Florida International University What's on tap: Tickets for the North Miami Brewfest now on sale Search Menu Menu Campus & Community What's on tap: Tickets for the North Miami Brewfest now on sale Annual beer festival promotes mission: Learn.Brew.Taste. By Ivonne Yee-Amor September 29, 2023 at 5:00pm Are you ready to try a sour pale ale? What about a tart green apple stout? These are among the more than 50 unique beer offerings at this year's North Miami Brewfest . Tickets just went on sale for the 11th annual festival, South Florida's only all inclusive, one-day beer and food festival, benefiting FIU's Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management . The North Miami Brewfest is scheduled to take place from 2 to 6 p.m. on Saturday, Nov, 18, in a new location, NOMI Village on 123 rd Street and NW 7 th Avenue in North Miami, just minutes from FIU’s Biscayne Bay Campus. The City of North Miami is the event’s title sponsor. “We are very excited to bring this event back to the community,” said Mohammad Qureshi, North Miami BrewFest director and FIU faculty administrator. “We have so many great breweries and restaurants participating again this year that we’re sure our guests will love,” he added. In its 11 th year, the North Miami Brewfest started at the Top 10-ranked FIU Chaplin School with the mission to contribute to brewing science education and innovation for the craft brew industry, brewpubs and home brew organizations. That mission continues today. So far, more than 30 breweries are scheduled to showcase their unique ales. More than 20 of them are FIU alumni owned or operated, among them 26 degree Brewing Co., Alchemy & Hops, Bay 13 Brewery and Kitchen, Beat Culture, Black Pit Brewing Co., Bread and Beer Buds, Cerveceria La Tropical, Conscious Brewing, Cove Brewery, Funky Buddha, HH Prison Pals Brewing Co., King FOX Brewery, Magic 13 Brewing Company, MIA Beer Company, Old Deck, Owl’s Brew, Pompano Beach Brewing Company, Rocketeeer Beer, Sour Sea Cow, Sun Lab, The Tank, Tarpon River Brewing, Tripping Animals, Unbranded Brewing Company, Uncommon Path Brewing, Unseen Creatures, VezaSur and Wynwood Brewing. In addition, students from Brew FIU will debut a special beer and members of the school's Bacardi Center of Excellence Bartender’s Guild, a student club at FIU, will curate an unique beer cocktail for the event. Festival tickets are all-inclusive, so that means a food feast too. Restaurants that will provide their best bites include Birra Bar, Chef Provisions, Crabs R Us Seafood, If and When Eats, Off the Hook Churrascuria, Old Joe’s Caribbean Grill, Piacere Wood Fired Pizza, Soufull Biscut and Twin Dragon Hibachi. FIU alumni restaurateurs will also be there, such as Kush by Stephens Delicatessan, Exquisite Catering by Robert, Night Owl Cookies, Raising Cane’s and Temple Street Eatery. Both VIP and general admission tickets are now on sale. To purchase tickets, visit go.fiu.edu/fiunomibrewfest or go to https://www.northmiamibrewfest.com/ for more information. Allison York NMBG President Finance, Membership,  Events/Fundraising Committees Quarter Celtic - ( https://quartercelticbrewpub.com ) Allison is an Albuquerque native with almost 25 years of restaurant experience specializing in taproom management. In her current role as General Manager of Quarter Celtic Brewery (original location), she organizes events, builds relationships with customers and staff, and handles the day-to-day of managing a medal-winning brewery. Allison’s motivation as a member of the NMBG Board of Directors is to inspire others in the beer community through education, active participation in beer festivals/events and timely communication. In her spare time Allison loves to hike with her dogs, discover or re-visit local breweries and distilleries, read, puzzle, binge watch and of course spend time with family and friends. Josh Trujillo NMBG Vice President Finance & Membership Committees La Cumbre Brewing- ( https://www.lacumbrebrewing.com ) Josh joined the industry in 2008 at Marble Brewery and was fortunate enough to learn my chops from two of the best brewers in the world, Daniel Jaramillo and Ted Rice.  He started in the pub as General Maintainence/Janitorial Dude and has worked his way through the ranks to achieve the title of Master Brewer.. He is  proud to have achieved some of the most recognized accomplishments and accolades in the beer industry, and looks forward to further helping the New Mexico beer industry and the community that surrounds it. Nick Henning NMBG Treasurer Finance & Membership Committee Santa Fe Brewing Co. ( https://santafebrewing.com ) Nick developed a diverse skill set across the Northeast, working from framing houses in Maine to maintaining jet engines in Michigan. In 2021, he transitioned to the beer industry in Dallas as a maintenance technician at Deep Ellum Brewing, where he advanced to manage a 40,000-barrel packaging line. Shortly after that, he moved to New Mexico to become the Packaging Manager at Santa Fe Brewing Co. Here, he has deeply immersed himself in the local brewing community, passionately leading the production team forward as well as advocating for the enjoyment of locally crafted beer.  As a member of the NMBG BOD, Nick pledges to support our local industry in whatever ways possible, be it lobbying lawmakers, assisting at events, or lending my technical expertise to others in the industry. Kristy Bounds NMBG Secretary Membership, Marketing,  & Events/Fundraising Committees Steel Bender Brewyard - ( https://steelbenderbrewyard.com ) Kristy moved to NM in 2008 for the sunshine and food but stayed for the beer. She started in the beer industry in 2019 as a student in the Brewing Program at CNM and as a server in 2020 at Brew Lab 101. Kristy gained brewing experience at Sidetrack Brewing Co. under the mentorship of David Kimbell formerly of Sidetrack Brewing Co. and CNM. Kristy graduated from CNM with an Associates Degree in Brewing and Beverage Management in 2022. She currently works at Steel Bender Brewyard in Los Ranchos de Albuquerque as a Shift Brewer. Kristy is also involved with the NM Chapter of the Pink Boots Society which is an organization that helps women and non binary individuals advance their careers in the fermentation industry through education. She will bring her passion for beer, enthusiasm for the industry and attention to detail to the board to help spread the word that New Mexico beer is world class. She believes our state should be recognized for the wealth of knowledge our brewers hold, from the smallest stovetop home brewer to the largest production brewery established over 35 years ago. Kristy is just beginning her career in this industry and wants to ensure New Mexico's craft beer story is told. Stevo Jeter NMBG Board Member Membership  Committee Ex Novo Brewing Co. - ( http://www.exnovobrew.com ) “My name is Stevo Jeter. I am currently the General Manager of Ex Novo Brewing Co in Corrales, NM. I am honored to say I've been a part of Ex Novo NM since we opened our doors in May of 2019. Before craft beer, I spent 17 years as a Morning Show host on the largest reaching FM Station in the state of NM. As a voice on a non-profit radio station I was able to connect and make an impact with many other outstanding non-profits throughout New Mexico. I have always had a deep love for this state, and am thankful that I get to be a part of our incredible craft beer community. Last year, Ex Novo was able to bring 26 breweries together for a collab fest, and raise money for the Somos Unidos Foundation. I had great pride in being a part of that amazing event that brought so many breweries together, and it's why I am throwing my name out there to potentially be a board member for the NMBG.” Jen LeVasseur NMBG Board Member Marketing,  Membership, Nominating, & Events/Fundraising Committees Ponderosa Brewing Co. - ( https://ponderosabrewing.com ) After living in Asia for 13 years and drinking beer all over the world, Jen decided to make the move to New Mexico in 2022 to attend the CNM Brewing Program. After receiving her brewing certificate, Jen then worked as a Packaging Technician and Cellar Person at Marble Brewery, where she gained invaluable experience from some of the best brewers in the state. In July 2024, Jen took over as Head Brewer at Ponderosa Brewery. In addition to already being an active participant in NM Brewers Guild events, she is involved with the New Mexico chapter of the Pink Boots society, an organization that supports women and non binary individuals in the fermentation industry. Jen is proud to be a part of the New Mexico craft beer community. She hopes to be able to share her passion and enthusiasm for the industry in order to help showcase the excellence of New Mexico craft beer to all. Jeremy Kinter NMBG Board Member Marketing,  Membership, & Events/Fundraising Committees Tractor Brewing Co. - ( https://getplowed.com ) Jeremy has worked for Tractor Brewing Company for 9 years. He started out has an Events & Marketing Assistant, moved to Events & Marketing Director, and has be Operations Manager for the past two years as well. Ebbie Edmonston NMBG Executive Director - ( director@nmbeer.org ) Raised in Phoenix, Arizona Ebbie got to experience a lot of what the Southwest has to offer. Between visiting the Grand Canyon, going to school in Sedona, and yearly trips to Santa Fe’s Indian Market, she is a true Southwesterner at heart. Ebbie moved to New Mexico in 2014 and immediately fell in love with the New Mexico beer community. She started her journey by working at Duel Brewing and learning the basics of beer. She continued her beer education by becoming a Cicerone Certified Beer Server and is actively working towards becoming a Certified Cicerone. Her position at Rowley Farmhouse Ales gave her the opportunity to become an expert in Belgian Beer styles. Her passion for beer exceeds tasting, as she also makes a conscious effort to educate and to encourage those around her about the history of beer. Ebbie is an active member of the New Mexico Pink Boots Society and plans to continue the efforts to raise awareness of women in the alcohol industry and advocate for fair treatment for all. She believes beer is a common thread, it is a tool to bring people together and it’s something that can be shared regardless of who you are or where you came from. It’s this magic that has inspired Ebbie to pursue this craft, and to be driven to push the beer community of New Mexico to the next level. Campus & Community Raise a glass to the North Miami BrewFest FIU Hospitalityâs premier beer festival offers perks to the FIU community By Ivonne Yee-Amor October 13, 2023 at 12:15pm It’s the only beer festival in South Florida where a ticket includes both beer and food. Now, there’s another reason to toast to the North Miami BrewFest: Organizers of the event announced a discount to the FIU community. Alumni, faculty, staff and students over 21 can use the promo code FIUFAM for a 15% discount on tickets. The festival is scheduled to take place from 2 p.m. to 6 p.m. on Saturday, Nov. 18, in a new location, NOMI Village on 123 rd Street and NW 7 th Avenue in North Miami. “We love our FIU family and are so appreciative of their enthusiasm for this festival,” said Mohammad Qureshi, North Miami BrewFest director and faculty administrator. “We hope this discount will help our loyal fans and beer aficionados save a little, while supporting our students and school.” FIU Hospitality alumni Alex Kuk ’04, MS’10 and Diego Ng '08, of Temple Street Eatery in Ft. Lauderdale, will be back this year. North Miami BrewFest is in its 11 th year. The one-day festival is produced by and benefits FIU’s Chaplin School of Hospitality & Tourism Management . More than 30 breweries and nearly 20 restaurants will be taking part in the event. More than half are FIU alumni-owned or operated and include some of the best breweries in South Florida and their one-of-a-kind beers, some made exclusively for the event. That includes the owners of Black Pit Brewing Company, who took 1 st Place for Best Brewery last year. Guests get to vote for both their favorite brewery and best restaurant. Last year, The Barrel BBQ, also an FIU alumni operated business, took home best restaurant. Best Brewer winners Black Pit Brewing Co., Bay 13 Brewery and Rocketeer Beer will be back in 2023. There will also be student-made beers on tap. Follow NOMIBREWFEST on Instagram to find out who will be there. The North Miami BrewFest mission is to contribute to brewing science education and innovation for the craft brew industry, brewpubs and home-brew organizations. Purchase tickets and learn more at the the festival site .
